title: Why Celery and Carrots Are Served with Chicken Wings

items.name: Origin
items.details: The tradition comes from the original Anchor Bar in Buffalo, NY, which served spicy fried wings with celery sticks and blue cheese dressing in the 1960s.

items.name: Why celery
items.details: Provides a cool, crisp contrast to the heat and grease of the wings.

items.name: Why blue cheese
items.details: The fat in blue cheese dressing helps temper the burn from the hot sauce.

items.name: Why carrots were added
items.details: Added later by other restaurants as a sweeter, equally cooling option alongside celery.

items.name: Why it stuck
items.details: It's cheap, easy, and makes the plate feel more balanced.

notes: A food history and pairing tradition dating back to the 1960s Buffalo wing origin.
